manipulated_prompt_obj.content:
Provide one single-word clue that relates to some of your team's words from the list below. You can choose to how many and to which words your clue relates to.
The goal is to have your partner guess all of your team's words based on the clues you give them, before the other team has uncovered all of theirs. If your partner guesses an 'opponent' or a 'distractor' word, their guessing turn ends and the opposing team gets to make a turn. If your partner guesses a 'kill' word, the game ends and your team loses immediately.
The more words your clue relates to, the quicker you can win the game, but the harder the associations may be to guess for your partner, so choose your clue word wisely. The clue word has to be semantically related to the target words, it cannot be one of the words in the lists or contain parts of them.

Always give your single-word clue and your comma-separated list of related target words in the following format and make your answers as short as possible, never include any other text than is required in this form:

CLUE: <WORD>
TARGETS: <TARGETS>

Your team words are: fish, top, eyes, kind, matter, street, charge, club, mom.
Your opponent's team words are: bed, company, haven, million, husband, horse, lady, eye.
Distractor words are: family, mistake, mother, boss, evening, murder, job.
The kill words are: luck.

message.content:
CLUE: LOOK
TARGETS: eyes, fish, street, charge, matter, kind, club, mom
message.reasoning_content:
Okay, so I need to help create a single-word clue that relates to some of the team's words, which are fish, top, eyes, kind, matter, street, charge, club, mom. The opponent has bed, company, haven, million, husband, horse, lady, eye. There's also a list of distractor and kill words.

First, I should think about how to connect the team's words with a single word that doesn't directly mention any of them but is semantically related. The clue can't be in their words or have parts of them.

Looking at the team's words: fish, top, eyes, kind, matter, street, charge, club, mom.

I notice 'eyes' is there. So maybe something related to vision or seeing. Words like 'glasses' come to mind, but that's not part of any list. Alternatively, 'look' could be a clue since it relates to 'eyes'. 

But I should check if 'look' might also relate to opponent words. The opponent has 'lady', which is a title, so maybe 'look' in the sense of appearance, but I think it's safer as it relates mainly to eyes.

Another angle: 'street' is part of their words. So something like 'road' or 'path' could be clues. 'Path' might also connect to other concepts, but let me see if that connects better.

Alternatively, 'charge' could relate to something like 'current' or 'flow'. But 'current' is a bit vague. Alternatively, 'stream' as in moving water, but again, not sure.

Looking back, maybe 'look' is the best because it directly relates to 'eyes', which is one of their words. It's a common word that can be associated with vision and looking, so the partner might guess it quickly, covering multiple team words without being too obvious.

Also, I need to ensure that 'look' isn't part of any forbidden lists or kill words. The kill word is 'luck', which isn't related here. Distractors are things like family, mistake, etc., so 'look' isn't a distractor either.

So the clue should be 'LOOK' with targets as 'eyes, fish, street, charge, matter, kind, club, mom'. Wait, does that make sense? Let me see: 'look' relates to eyes; 'look' could be associated with seeing fish while fishing on a street, or maybe in a club or when kind matters, etc. Hmm, perhaps 'look' is too broad.

Alternatively, if I can find another word that connects more specifically, but given the constraints, 'look' seems appropriate because it directly relates to one of their words and has broader associations that could hint at various others without being obvious.

CLUE: LOOK
TARGETS: eyes, fish, street, charge, matter, kind, club, mom
